greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of divisors of n that are not greater than the cubefree kernel of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The cubefree kernel of 56 = 7 * 2^3 is 28 = 7 * 2^2 and the divisors <= 28 of 56 are {1, 2, 4, 7, 8, 14, 28}, therefore a(56) = 1 + 2 + 4 + 7 + 8 + 14 + 28 = 64.
program: (PARI) a007948(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 2] = min(f[i, 2], 2)); factorback(f);
a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*(d<=a007948(n))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 07 2015
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 19 2002
